titles: An elegy upon the unfortunate death of Captain William Bedloe, who departed this life, on Fryday the twentieth of August. 1680.
publisher: Printed for John Gay, at the Flying-Horse between St. Dunstan's Church and Chancery-Lane.,
notes: Verse: "How fickle is the state of all mankind? ..."
Within mourning borders, with emblems and motto.
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
keywords: Bedloe, William, 1650-1680 --  Poetry --  Early works to 1800.
